results.title: Swing and sing
results.brief_description: A collection of big band jazz music with classic songs “The Boogie Woogieman”, “Dancing on air” and “Fantasia” which eventually set the popular tunes and rhythms in 1950s United States. Featuring Will Osborne and his Orchestra, Martha Tilton - Brian Sisters and the Aida Broadbent Dancers.

results.title: Swimming
results.brief_description: Swimming is about the tug of the tide. In an effort to make sense out of the confusion, 12 year old Lee Johnson decides to make a movie of her life using her Dad’s home video camera. She confronts the sticky question of her identity and searches for answers in the cobwebbed corners of domesticity. Some things, it seems, are better left alone. She finds herself drawn, inevitably, towards an unwanted ending.

results.title: Swim and live
results.creator_credit: Syd Wood, Frank Killian and Movietone Productions
results.brief_description: Describes the progressive steps in learning to swim and how a life can be lost by not being able to swim. Illustrates different swimming styles and shows a championship swimming event. Features Olympic champion Murray Rose.

results.title: Swift and sure
results.brief_description: This film shows some of the vast array of modern communication equipment and training of the Royal Australian Signals’ Personnel who operate and maintain it. A signal message from Papua is shown passing through various processes of transmission en route to Canberra.

results.title: Swedish peasant paintings
results.brief_description: A study of the “gourd” paintings done by the itinerant peasant artists who flourished in the Dalecarlia district of Sweden in the eighteenth century. The scenes usually have a religious content, although floral motifs are frequently used. The diea of the gourd as the symbol of life is taken from the Book of Jonah and recurs throughout these domestic paintings.

results.title: Swedish cinema classics
results.creator_credit: Gardar Sahlberg, Svensk Filmindustri and Swedish Institute
results.brief_description: The great period of Swedish silent cinema - the epoch of Victor Sjostrom and Mauritz Stiller - is remembered in a series of commented sequences from their original works.

results.title: Sweden is horrible
results.creator_credit: Karsten Wedel, Radio Sweden and Wedel Films
results.brief_description: Swedish “sin” is better known throughout the world than Swedish steel, to judge by the interest shown by many foreign publications. This film will either help to confirm preconceived notions on this subject or, perhaps, give you ideas about greater sexual equality.

results.title: Swan song = Jue xiang
results.creator_credit: Zhang Zeming and Pearl River Film Studio
results.brief_description: A simple, moving, and allegorical story of an ageing composer of traditional Cantonese music. His harried later years are a reflection of the political vicissitudes of New China. Mandarin and Cantonese dialogue with English subtitles.

results.title: Susso kids
results.brief_description: Crops might just as well be ploughed into the ground or left to rot in the sun! From Black Thursday, October 1929, Australian productivity had never been higher, but there was no market for it. This documentary depicts causes and effects of the Great Depression in Australia, using film clips of the period. Shows the divisive effect of the disparity in living conditions, attempts by the unemployed to improve their social and economic circumstances and the plight of the children. Linked by songs of the period. Commentary by Telford Jackson.
